options.systemMessage:
=You are a JSON extraction assistant.

Your job is to convert any user request into a simple JSON object that captures:
- intent
- target entity
- location
- filters (conditions like numbers, comparisons, or attributes)

Rules:
- Output ONLY valid JSON (no explanations or extra text).
- Use plain, readable keys.
- Do not assume missing data â€” set unknown values to null.

Output format:

{
  "intent": "",
  "entity": "",
  "location": "",
  "filters": {}
}

={
    "aiHasSalary": false,

    "populateExternalApplyURL": false,
    "remote": false,
    "limit": 10,
    "removeAgency": false,
    "titleSearch": [
        "{{ $json.output.entity }}"
    ],
    "locationSearch": [
        "{{ $json.output.location }}"
    ]
}

json.description_text:
Advertising & Graphic Designer | AI Startup | London | On-site

About The Company

Albert Bow has partnered with a rapidly scaling AI business serving global enterprise clients. With demand accelerating and the marketing function being built from scratch, they're creating a dedicated design team to deliver highâ€‘impact campaigns and worldâ€‘class creative.

This is an opportunity to be part of the founding creative bench - shaping campaigns seen across major digital and physical channels.

The Role

Weâ€™re hiring an Advertising & Graphic Designer to craft high-impact visual campaigns across digital, social, and outâ€‘ofâ€‘home channels. This role blends advertising creativity with strong graphic design execution - perfect for someone who loves translating concepts into scroll-stopping, conversationâ€‘starting visuals.

What Youâ€™ll Do

Design digital and physical advertising assets: OOH, billboards, paid social, email, website visuals, and more
Develop campaign concepts and bring them to life across static, motion, and mixed media
Produce engaging content for channels like LinkedIn, YouTube, and key industry touchpoints
Collaborate with content, motion, and photography teams on integrated campaigns
Create visual narratives that simplify complex topics into crisp, compelling creative
Use emerging and generative AI tools to enhance and accelerate creative workflows
Maintain brand consistency while pushing bold, fresh campaign ideas

What Weâ€™re Looking For

5-7 years experience in advertising design, graphic design, or integrated campaign work
Agency or in-house advertising background preferred
Strong portfolio showcasing digital campaigns, social assets, OOH, and motion-friendly designs
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite; experience with video/motion workflows a plus
Ability to deliver high-quality work at speed, adapting quickly as priorities shift
Strong collaborator who's comfortable working cross-functionally in a fast-paced team

What Youâ€™ll Get

A chance to build a marquee creative function from day one
Creative ownership over campaigns across every major channel
Constant experimentation with new techniques and tools (including AI)
A high-trust, high-velocity environment where great work gets shipped - fast

Interested? Apply today or send your CV directly to cailacunningham@albertbow.com.

Looking forward to speaking soon,

json.title: Senior Graphic Designer
json.linkedin_org_description:
Weâ€™re all about happiness you can wear. Our story begins in 1991.

Contrarian. How else would you describe a man who left a good job in the city â€“ working in New York during its shiny â€™80s heyday no less â€“ to set up a mail-order clothes company at a time when buying things that got delivered was considered a bit, well, joke-worthy? Or was he just lucky â€“ right time, right place, right instinct?

Johnnie launched Boden with a hand-drawn catalogue featuring eight menswear styles he wanted in his own wardrobe (and wanted to order from his armchair). That was 1991, and back then, catalogues for stylish people who like stylish clothes werenâ€™t really a â€˜thingâ€™ in Britain.

Today, after a wild, unpredictable and exciting 30 years, Boden is a global company but it still has the same family vibes. Itâ€™s the opinion of the women in his life â€“ his wife Sophie (who pushed him to follow his dream in the first place), his three discerning daughters and Johnnieâ€™s new lovely female sidekick â€“ Janet the dog â€“ that he values over anything.

Originality is also so very important, with every step taken to set Boden apart from the rest. Whether thatâ€™s hand-drawn prints, doing our best to make sure we donâ€™t cut corners and even listing words we cannot use (we copywriters love a challenge). Attention to detail is everything, and it shows. Johnnie has also been adamant that every factory we use respects its workforce in the same way he respects his workforce at home. And that Boden uses as many recycled materials as possible.

â€œHis main piece of advice is always be yourself,â€ his daughter Katie adds. â€œI think weâ€™re all flawed but thatâ€™s the one thing that we [the family] are â€“ very honest. I just think you canâ€™t go wrong by being honest.â€ And lastly? â€œHeâ€™s also never tried to be coolâ€¦which makes him cool.â€

Boden isnâ€™t about fast fashion and fads. It never was. Itâ€™s about making clothes that put a smile on your face, for a long, long time.
json.description_text:
Stylish, grounded, uplifting â€“ these values live through everything we do at Boden. Without the collaboration, honesty and friendship between our teams, we wouldnâ€™t be where we are today. We curate a world of beauty thatâ€™s ethical, inclusive â€“ and importantly â€“ good fun. We inspire you to live your best life. We are Boden.

Overview

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Graphic Designer to join our Creative team, reporting to the Creative Design Lead. Youâ€™ll craft standout design across online features, emails, catalogue pages, PR pieces, and digital site assets â€” creating work that inspires both new and existing customers.

With strong experience across both print and digital, youâ€™ll bring excellent typography, confident layout skills, and the ability to maintain a consistent, recognisable brand look and feel across all channels.

This role will play a key part in evolving our creative strategy to be digital-first, elevating the Boden brand through thoughtful concepting, storytelling, and best-in-class design. Youâ€™ll be tuned into cultural, digital, and fashion trends and confident collaborating across teams to deliver work that brings our collections and campaigns to life.

What You Will Do

Bring the Boden tone of voice to life visually â€” and help shape how it evolves.
Champion consistency in typography, layout, and brand expression across all channels.
Interpret briefs clearly, understanding purpose and audience, and delivering exceptional design solutions.
Develop and present concepts for seasonal and brand campaigns.
Lead digital projects end-to-end, from initial idea to final delivery.
Act as design lead on seasonal campaigns, ensuring cohesion across all touchpoints.
Create engaging, best-practice content across digital platforms.
Put the customer at the heart of every design decision.
Present creative ideas confidently to stakeholders across the business.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to push creative boundaries.
Ensure copy, content, and design align seamlessly.
Use knowledge of upcoming collections to shape creative direction.
Stay aware of industry and platform-specific trends, ensuring our content feels fresh and relevant.

What We Are Looking For

Established expertise within a midâ€“senior or senior design role, either in-house or agency side.
Established expertise within a midâ€“senior or senior design role, either in-house or agency side.
Proven expertise across Figma, Adobe Creative Suite and After Effects; AI design experience is a bonus.
Able to confidently shape concepts, lead campaigns, and deliver polished, on-brand creative.
Comfortable overseeing multiple projects and maintaining a high standard of output.
Skilled in presenting ideas and influencing design direction across the business.
Strong understanding of typography, layout and brand guardianship.
Up to date with cultural, design and fashion trends.
A supportive team player with experience guiding more junior creatives.

What We Offer

Competitive salary & targeted annual bonus scheme.
Generous Boden clothing allowance!
30% discount on all current clothing ranges.
25 days Holiday annually, plus Bank Holidays.
Online Portal with an array of discounts on retail & entertainment.
Virtual GP Service for you and your household!
Free onsite parking and subsidised cafÃ©.

We want Boden to be the place everyone wants to work. Friendly, open and tolerant. A best-of-British company with diverse teams, equal opportunities, and fair working and recruitment practices. We believe in hiring the best person for the job, whoever they are, helping them thrive in it and celebrating their individuality.

We would like to encourage people from a diverse range of backgrounds to apply for our roles. If you need any reasonable adjustments or additional support during your application process, please do not hesitate to let us know.

25 Days Holiday Annually Plus Bank Holidays
Online Portal with an Array of Discounts on Retail & Entertainment

Job Title: Mid 2D Designer
Salary: Â£40-45k
Location: London (East)
Reporting to: Senior 2D Designer
Job Ref: 40001

Role Summary: 

As a Mid 2D Designer, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to shape and execute compelling visual concepts across a range of touchpoints, from live projects to internal communications and pitches. In this role, youâ€™ll collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to push creative boundaries, bringing fresh ideas to life while demonstrating confidence in your design decisions. Youâ€™ll have a strong background in event design and be comfortable working across both print and digital media.

Responsibilities:

- Lead the creation of innovative event concepts and graphic design languages, balancing creativity with thoughtful execution.
- Contribute to the creative direction of client projects, enhancing their brand identity to elevate creative expression.
- Oversee the implementation of 2D design concepts, incorporating feedback from internal teams and clients to ensure project success.
- Support the Creative Leaders by developing compelling presentations that communicate Wonderâ€™s creative ideas and vision to clients.
- Collaborate with the team to incorporate strong visual language into various event elements, including 3D environments, standalone projects, and digital executions.
- Lead design elements within projects, balancing creative ambition with practical solutions to meet production requirements.
- Guide and mentor junior designers, providing feedback and support to foster their growth while maintaining the highest standards of creative output.

Experience/Skills:

- 2D Designer with 3+ years of experience, in a similar role, ideally within the events or experiential design sector.

- Exceptional attention to detail and a keen eye for design quality.

json.linkedin_org_slogan: Find partners and clients. Close deals remotely. Expand to new markets.
json.linkedin_org_description:
Imagine a place on the internet where businesses can find deals, partners, clients, and trade products or services in a few clicks.
Well, that place is called Enterprise League and it's the world's B2B collaboration platform.
We started it in 2019 with the belief that the smallest businesses often have the biggest hearts. However, we also knew that they often face the biggest issues so we wanted to help them overcome them.
Hence, over time the platform grew to host all business deals on the internet, and to serve as a meeting point for SMEs and startups - regardless of their location or budget.
json.description_text:
An Extra Ambitious Startup 

At Enterprise League, we are passionate about helping people improve the way they do business. We are on a mission to help millions of entrepreneurs expand their business horizon and increase their companyâ€™s success. If youâ€™re excited about projects that could change the world, weâ€™d love for you to join us.

Enterprise League is a B2B collaborations platform for startups and small businesses, that embodies five core values: being creative; empowering others; staying tenacious; taking ownership; showing flair.

Our core values enable us to create a culture of raving fans for both our clients and our team. If you want to work in an ultra-positive environment with a team that is motivated, ambitious and collaborative, then we would love to hear from you.

The Role

Enterprise League is searching for a super creative 2D Graphic Designer to join our company. They will be able to create original, exciting and beautiful creative solutions in both 2D.

As a Graphic Designer, you will be working in the design department to produce high quality 2D characters, animations, UI design, background and Symbols. You will be involved in the entire life cycle of animation development, including initial concept, asset creation and development. You will be influential in key stakeholder decision making and have the privilege to create projects with the potential to grow worldly popular.

Job Description

Create stunning visual motion graphics for a variety of B2B marketing campaigns and creative brand projects.
Visually illustrate different designs and ideas, making sure to adhere to briefs and brand guidelines
Collaborate with the creative team to brainstorm new ideas and concepts for projects
Convert complex project briefs into powerful visual concepts and animations taking ownership of that process from start to finish
Have the ability to keep up-to-date with the latest software updates and industry best practice
Attention to detail is crucial whilst being able to meet deadlines. You will be able to build content quickly and to a high standard.
Bring your insight to all existing visual communication by offering innovative design solutions, sharing your ideas to set Enterprise League apart from the competition.

Essential Skills

Adobe Suite (Photoshop, After Effects, XD, Premier Pro)
2D Post Production
2D characters, backgrounds and symbols
UI, layout, 2D logos 

Desirable Skills

Have a grounding in design and design theory
You will have the creative and technical skills to design graphics, and a stunning showreel to prove it
Be passionate for impactful concepts and visual ideas that resonate with audiences
3-4 years experience in 2D/3D graphics design
Strong illustration / drawing skills are definitely a plus.
Approach the creative process collaboratively, seeking the feedback of others to sharpen ideas into fully fledged designs.
Be efficient and able to adapt to processes and systems easily
Have strong organizational and time management skills
Work with an approachable, transparent and mindful mindset
3D Design (Studio max, etc) & 3D characters

Weâ€™d love to see your portfolio alongside your CV, so please submit both for consideration.

Email us at info@enterpriseleague.com 

Apply for this job

json.linkedin_org_description:
At Ocean Outdoor, we lead the way in premium large format Digital Out of Home advertising.

Our art is turning Spaces into Places through a deep understanding of our environments. We define ourselves by building commercial value from existing Spaces and turning them into high value Places, creating multi-sensory brand experiences with tangible business outcomes for brands and landlord partners alike. 

We handpick only the busiest and best places for our screens, across 18 of the UKâ€™s top cities to-date. These iconic 'Ask for it by NameÂ®'Â locations include London's Piccadilly Lights, BFI IMAX, Liverpool Media Wall and Manchester's Printworks SkyLights.  Our uniqueness also comes from our networks at scale such as The Grid and The Loop. 

We are insight led and creatively driven throughout, whether itâ€™s our 10 years of pioneering Neuroscience research or the latest from Ocean Studio and Ocean Labs, such as 3D DeepScreenÂ®. 

These are the elements that are core to our values and commitment to our clients.
json.description_text:
We are the market leading Digital Out Of Home (DOOH) company in Northern Europe. We create high impact digital canvases for inspirational advertising, leveraging the latest technology to enhance engagement and audience reach. 

At Ocean everyone is welcome, our core values of Freedom, Quality, Passion, Enterprise and Knowledge drive our culture of collaboration. We believe diversity drives innovation and strive to create workplaces that reflect the communities we serve, and where everyone feels empowered to bring their best selves to work.

Working within our in-house design team, youâ€™ll be responsible for everything â€˜brand Oceanâ€™ from our website, emails, presentations, videos and print. Youâ€™ll develop the visual aspects of our marketing campaigns, as well as nurturing and evolving the brand identity. You have an experienced, well-rounded knowledge of various creative software and a natural eye for design. 

The artistic ability to design something that resonates with our clients whilst having the capacity to learn is essential. As a design team, weâ€™re constantly learning from each other, adapting and sharing new skills, tools, resources and techniques. We want to help with your development and we want to learn from you too! 

What you will be doing 
â€¢ Working within the Ocean in-house design team, but across different Ocean departments to generate concepts, develop ideas and produce final designs across all our platforms: 
â—¦ Marketing emails, blogs, e-magazines and social media graphics. 
â—¦ New product and post campaign videos. 
â—¦ Sales presentations, pitches and tender documents. 
â—¦ Marketing leaflets, brochures, business cards and event banners and displays. 
â—¦ Nurturing our brand and values while providing your own style on new product logos, colour palettes, typography and imagery. 
â—¦ Help our in-house studio team with brand campaign artwork. 
â—¦ Working on briefs from the Sales and Ocean Labs departments. 
â—¦ Brainstorming ideas for campaigns using Oceanâ€™s locations and technologies. 
â—¦ Creating compelling visuals (photos, videos or sketches) of concepts based on supplied assets, as well as any that can be sourced online. 
â€¢ Conduct independent research on industry trends, competitors and target audiences for relevant projects. 
â€¢ Helping to build and maintain a library of assets / templates. 
â€¢ Having a strong understanding of all of Oceanâ€™s inventory and services so as best to advise on and create concepts. 
â€¢ Ensuring highest design and usability standards are maintained. 

Qualifications and Experience 
â€¢ Educated to degree level, preferably in a related field (or work experience in a relevant area will be considered). 
â€¢ A strong understand and experience of 
â—¦ Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Premiere Pro and After Effects. 
â—¦ Keynote and Powerpoint. 
â—¦ Experience of web development languages and tools, particularly WordPress CMS and basic HTML (beneficial but not essential). 
â—¦ Photography and videography techniques (beneficial but not essential). 
â—¦ Experience using 3D software such as Cinema 4D or Blender (beneficial but not essential). 
â€¢ Demonstrated ability to solve problems, work within budgets, in a team and to tight deadlines. 
â€¢ Experience in an in-house design role (beneficial but not essential). 

Personal Characteristics 
â€¢ An interest for design and visual arts, keeping up with trends and methods. 
â€¢ Excellent time management skills. 
â€¢ Excellent attention to detail. 
â€¢ Strong team player with a willing to learn and the ability to give and take constructive criticism. 

To apply for this role, please provide a comprehensive CV and portfolio.

Ocean is an equal opportunity employer and is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We believe diversity of background, perspectives, and experience, enhance all that we do. We will give all applications fair consideration.

json.linkedin_org_description:
Zelens represents a new generation of skincare developed using breakthrough scientific research in the biological functions of the skin.

Our innovation is driven by founder Dr. Marko Lens'â€‹ 20 years of research in skin ageing, his clinical experience as a plastic and reconstructive surgeon and his deep knowledge of formulation chemistry combining active biotechnology ingredients with pure molecules derived from botanicals.

Combining biotechnology and botanicals is not enough. Zelens products combine powerful high-performance active biotechnology ingredients with the unique blend of plant-derived molecules with potent anti-ageing and healing properties.

But simply combining ingredients derived from both sources does not create truly effective skin care. Ingredients must be carefully selected, science-backed and integrated in a formula to work in synergy. Only the exact balance and synergistic action of all ingredients can effectively trigger cellular processes necessary for skin regeneration and repair.

The sophisticated technology of our formulations including multiple ingredients that work in balance and synergy is essential to the remarkable effectiveness of Zelens products.

The leading edge in skin care. Always. Zelens'â€‹ consistent skincare innovation is the result of Dr. Lens'â€‹ continuous research, development and testing. Every Zelens product represents the most advanced, most effective skincare technology available anywhere.

Other good things to know:
Zelens products are extensively tested for safety and efficacy by renowned independent laboratories. Zelens uses no animal testing and no animal-derived ingredients. Zelens uses no parabens. Zelens is committed to eco-responsibility.
json.description_text:
Company Description
Zelens is a cutting-edge skincare brand combining breakthrough scientific research with advanced biotechnology and potent plant-derived molecules. Founded by Dr. Marko Lens, who brings over 20 years of research and clinical expertise, Zelens specialises in creating innovative science-backed products aimed at skin regeneration and repair.

Role Description
This is a full-time, hybrid role for a mid-weight Graphic Designer at our London location. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, with great attention to detail and have 5+ yearsâ€™ experience in graphic design. Weâ€™re looking for someone who is aesthetically sensitive to all things Beauty - and ideally Skincare - to join our Marketing Team. This role would be best suited to someone who loves creative design, whilst understanding and adhering to the visual direction and codes of the brand.

This position reports to the Head of Marketing. You will work alongside our Head of Social and E-Commerce to create a broad suite of assets across all digital and offline channels, ensuring that the brandsâ€™ key pillars are accurately conveyed.


Key Responsibilities

Brand visual development: assist in the development and evolution of Zelensâ€™ visual identity, working closely with external agencies where required.
Digital design: working with the marketing and sales team to create assets for the website, emails, social (paid and organic), retail and other digital marketing channels ensuring consistency across all touchpoints.
Print design: press releases, in-store signage, packaging and carton design. Visual merchandising and planograms experience are a plus, but not a requirement.
Creative direction: ideating the creative direction for brand campaigns (alongside the Creative Director were appropriate), product launches, promotions and eventing.
Photoshoot concepting, planning and assistance: working closely with the Creative Director to develop photography concepts; assist with the planning and organisation of photoshoots (shot lists, call sheets, product ordering, prop sourcing etc). 
Ownership of brand imagery: ownership and management of all brand imagery and assets.


Skills and Qualifications

Experience: 5+ years in design, preferably in beauty or fashion for a premium or prestige brand/s. A strong portfolio showcasing an elevated, refined aesthetic with a keen attention to detail and expertise in digital and print design.
Technical skills: advanced skills in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Indesign), motion graphics / video editing. The ideal candidate will need to be highly proficient in leveraging AI-powered tools for advanced image and video editing, creation, and enhancement. This includes using generative AI platforms to accelerate creative workflows, develop visual concepts, upscale or retouch media, as well as the production of dynamic video content with efficiency and precision. An ability to demonstrate an understanding of how AI integrates into modern design pipelines - enhancing creativity rather than replacing it â€“ and of adapting to emerging technologies to maintain an elevated visual style is vital.
Innovation and trend awareness: being able to identify emerging design trends, particularly within the beauty and luxury space, as well as what is happening within the wider design world, is important in order to keep Zelensâ€™ brand assets current and relevant. 
Project management: the ability to work efficiently with excellent organisational skills. Skilled management of multiple projects with tight deadlines is a must, as well as the ability to effectively communicate across departments.

At Keplin Group, more than just a rapidly growing consumer goods business a team
of innovators, creators, and go-getters. Known for bringing practical, quality-led products into
homes across the UK, now turning up the volume on our digital presence. where you
come in.

About the Role:

A vibrant, supportive team culture where your creativity will be valued

Our superModels include original characters to suit every taste and fantasy, as well as digital twins of top real-world creators.
json.description_text:
About Us

Oh is building the OpenAI of the spicy content industry. Weâ€™re a company at the forefront of the generative AI revolution, combining cutting-edge models developed in-house, with proprietary data sources and distribution via our consumer platform, OhChat, and market-leading API.

OhChat now has over 250,000 users and hosts Digital Twins of household names, and our API is integrated into some of the biggest platforms in the adult content space, distributing those Digital Twins across the internet. Backed by $10M in venture funding, weâ€™re quickly establishing ourselves as the dominant, essential layer for adult creators and platforms to adopt AI.

Our aim is for OhChat to be the leading â€œAI OnlyFansâ€ platform and our API to be the go-to for all adult platforms wanting the technology and our Digital Twinsâ€™ IP, in a combined package - ultimately we aim to be the most dominant AI player in the entire adult industry, ahead of expansion to adjacent industries such as companionship and more general creator industry.

Websites: oh.xyz & ohchat.com

Purpose of the Role

Weâ€™re looking for a modern, versatile Graphic Designer to join our Marketing team and help define how Oh shows up visually across every touchpoint.

Youâ€™ll be responsible for creating high-impact, on-brand design across social, campaigns, in-product assets, event collateral, marketing materials, and more. From TikTok thumbnails and paid social ads to in-platform promos, pitch decks, and graphics for video, youâ€™ll be the go-to design partner for the Head of Marketing and wider team.

This role is ideal for someone whoâ€™s fluent in consumer brands and technology, comfortable working in a fast-paced startup.

Youâ€™ll report directly to the Head of Marketing and work closely with Growth, PR, Creator, and Product teams. Weâ€™re open to full-time or freelance applicants, ideally based in the UK or a nearby time zone.

Key Responsibilities

Brand & visual identity
Evolve and maintain Ohâ€™s visual identity across all channels, ensuring everything we ship feels cohesive, premium, and recognisably â€œOhâ€. 
Create and update brand guidelines, design systems, and reusable components (colour, typography, iconography, layouts). 
Campaign & marketing design
Design campaign assets for product launches, creator launches, partnerships and performance marketing. 
Produce static and lightweight motion assets for paid social, display, email, and landing pages. 
Social & content design
Create scroll-stopping assets for TikTok, Instagram, X and Reddit, working closely with the Social and Growth teams. 
Design templates for recurring social formats (memes, carousels, announcements, stats, creator spotlights). 
In-platform & product-facing design
Design in-app banners, promotional modules, and visual treatments for characters and Digital Twins. 
Collaborate with Product and UX to ensure marketing assets feel native in the product experience. 
Video & motion support
Create graphics, lower thirds, title cards, and simple motion pieces for editor and video content. 
Work with our video editor to develop a cohesive motion style for Oh. 
Event & sales collateral
Design event collateral for conferences and trade shows (booth graphics, roll-ups, print materials, merch concepts). 
Support B2B/API sales with clear, compelling decks and one-pagers that explain what we do. 
Process, quality, and collaboration
Manage your workload and brief intake with the Head of Marketing to keep priorities clear and deadlines realistic. 
Champion design quality and consistency while moving fast in a startup environment. 
Maintain organised design files and libraries (e.g. Figma, Adobe CC) that others can easily work with. 
Skills And Experience Required

3+ yearsâ€™ experience as a Graphic Designer (in-house, agency, or high-growth startup), with a strong consumer / product / tech angle. 
A portfolio that demonstrates:
Excellent visual taste and typography
Strong social/campaign design
Consistent brand systems across multiple touchpoints
Proficiency in modern design tools (e.g. Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud as a minimum). 
Experience designing for social media, digital campaigns and product environments (web/app). 
Comfort working with NSFW/adult content and creator-led brands. 
Basic motion design skills (e.g. After Effects, Premiere, or similar) or willingness to level up quickly. 
Ability to interpret loose briefs, ask smart questions, and turn ideas into clear, high-quality visuals. 
Highly organised, able to manage multiple projects and stakeholders and hit deadlines. 
Strong communication skills and the confidence to defend good work while remaining open to feedback. 

Weâ€™re open to both full-time and freelance applicants. Please include a portfolio or showreel with your application.

As part of our team, youâ€™ll enjoy:

The hustle of a startup with the impact of a global business. 
Tremendous opportunity to join a business pioneering the future of creator engagement. 
Working with an extraordinary team of smart, creative, fun, and highly motivated people. 
Flexible working hours, including remote working. 
Modern, uplifting work environment. 
Pension scheme. 
Competitive salary / day rate, depending on experience and contract type. 

Ready to help create the most immersive AI experiences on the planet? Weâ€™d love to hear from you.

json.job_description:
About Populous

For more than 40 years Populous has had a singular focus â€“ to draw people together around the things that they love, to be the leading design firm that specialises in places, spaces and events where people gather. Our success is defined by designing projects that are seen as the benchmark. We are committed to future innovation, anticipating and shaping the future of our industries.

Our team is made up of highly talented people with a range of skills, all integral to successfully bringing to life the places and experiences we design. As our company has grown, our expertise has expanded to encompass a wide variety of disciplines â€“ including architecture, audiovisual consultancy, brand activation, design & build, events, food & beverage strategy, interior design, landscape architecture, urban design and wayfinding.

This varied expertise enables us to transform neighbourhoods, revitalise cities, build relationships and create buildings, places and spaces that draw people together, from the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium to The Co-op Live Arena.

As we continue to bring to life award-winning venues and experiences our EMEA Practice is looking for a Junior Graphic Designer based in our Shoreditch studio.

About the Role

This role sits within our Wayfinding team. The position is varied and fast-paced; from ideating big ideas to finessing the finer details across pictograms, typeface and graphic design layout.

Key responsibilities include:
 * Produce and present early sketches and storyboards, through to final concept designs and development of those designs.
 * Bring fresh ideas and perspectives to the team through research, knowledge and expertise
 * Contribute to pushing creative boundaries to enhance the graphic design output of the team
 * Participate in brainstorming sessions, design sprints, internal workshops to bring a graphic design perspective to design discussions
 * Presenting design exploration and idea generation internally in team workshops


Key requirements include:
 * Driven by originality, with a talent for inventing fresh ideas
 * A people person â€“ open minded and someone who will bring your perspective, personality and culture to our team
 * Eager to learn and support across a variety of projects
 * Adobe Creative Suite
 * After Effects and/or Premiere Pro experience is advantageous


About the Studio

Our Worship St studio is located just a short walk from Shoreditch High St Station, surrounded by well-known bars and restaurants and with excellent travel connections. Our employees enjoy a comprehensive and competitive benefits programme, as well as the opportunity to attend events at several Populous-designed venues.

Why Join the Team?
 * Work alongside passionate, creative individuals who lead their industry, transform ideas into reality and celebrate the beauty of human connection
 * Enjoy various benefits, such as hybrid working and gym membership discounts
 * Enjoy the opportunity to attend events at Populous-designed venues
 * Connect and learn at regular social and knowledge sharing events including an annual conference and a weekend abroad Christmas party


How to Apply

Populous is an equal opportunity employer. If youâ€™re ready to utilise your skills to support our growing practice, click â€œApplyâ€ to begin the application process. In your application, please include your CV and a one-page letter of motivation (cover letter), salary expectations, and availability
Want to learn more about us?

Find us here: Populous
Populous | Facebook
Instagram: @WeArePopulous
X: @Populous

As a Licensed Graphic Designer, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping licensed collections for menswear, womenswear, and kidswear. You’ll be entrusted to interpret global trends, harness renowned character licenses, and bring imaginative concepts to life. Every collection you help design will play its part in our client’s continued growth, and in the development of your own professional portfolio.

What You'll Do:

  • Create engaging, original graphics for licensed apparel across men’s, women’s, and children’s categories.
  • Partner closely with fellow designers and cross-functional teams to deliver innovative, commercially successful ranges.
  • Maintain brand integrity through meticulous attention to license guidelines and artwork quality.
  • Support seasonal trend research and conceptualise new ideas that set your collections apart.
  • Produce detailed artwork files and tech packs, ensuring each design is production-ready.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Minimum 2 years’ recent experience in licensed graphic design for fashion/apparel (menswear, womenswear or kidswear).
  • Demonstrated proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop) and strong technical artwork skills.
  • Exceptional communicator and enthusiastic team player who thrives in a collaborative setting.
  • Deep passion for the licensed clothing market and a keen eye for trends and character brands.
  • Located in London and fully eligible to work in the UK.

The Benefits and Why It’s Special

Joining our client means more than stepping into a job; it’s your chance to develop with one of the UK’s top suppliers, where your ideas shape the future of licensed fashion. Enjoy a competitive salary, supportive colleagues, and genuine pathways for learning, advancement, and creative achievement.

Ready to Inspire the Next Big licensing Collections ?

We’d love to connect if you share our client’s passion for licensed design and see yourself thriving in a positive, people-first setting. Send us your CV , we’re excited to introduce you to an opportunity where talent is noticed and ambition is rewarded.

“We will endeavour to contact you within 48 hours of receiving your CV, however due to the nature of our business this may be delayed due to meetings, holidays and offsite visits. If you have not had a response within 7 days then please assume that your application has been unsuccessful, due to high volume response unfortunately we are unable to reply to all applicants.”

Dobson Welch – Where Opportunity Meets Talent

json.job_description:
Graphic Designer



Â£34,000 - Â£38,000 FTE Pro Rata plus benefits

Reports to: Senior Creative Designer

Directorate: Marketing, Fundraising & Engagement

Contract: Permanent

Hours: Part time, 21 hours per week (3 days per week)

Location: Stratford, London Office-based with high flexibility (1-2 days per week in the office)

Closing date: 07th December 2025 23:55

This vacancy may close earlier if a high volume of applications is received or once a suitable candidate is found, therefore we strongly recommend that you apply early to avoid disappointment. Please let us know if there is anything about the recruitment process that you would like to discuss, in particular if there are any changes or adjustments that would make it easier for you to apply. Please contact recruitment@cancer.org.uk or 020 3469 8400 as soon as possible.

Visa sponsorship: You must be eligible to work in the UK to apply for this vacancy. Cancer Research UK is not able to offer visa sponsorship.

Recruitment process: Competency based interview



At Cancer Research UK, we exist to beat cancer.

We are looking for a creative Graphic Designer to join us in Cancer Research UKâ€™s creative team, The Studio, includes Graphic, Motion, Information and Product Design teams.

As part of a large multidisciplinary team, youâ€™ll collaborate daily and work side-by-side with other specialists in your discipline. All members of The Studio are responsible for delivering impactful, relevant and audience-led creative.

Youâ€™ll work on all Cancer Research UK and partner brands across all marketing and communication channels. And together we work to support Cancer Research UKâ€™s vision for a future where everyone lives longer, better lives, free from the fear of cancer




WHAT WILL I BE DOING?

 * Working autonomously to lead and deliver independent design projects, confidently presenting and articulating ideas and solutions to commissioning teams.
 * Following established methods of quality assurance and operational processes. Always delivering work on time to the highest standard and maintaining positive stakeholder relationships.
 * Using skills and expertise to deliver ideas and creative solutions across print and digital, in response to briefs and creative challenges for a broad range of commissioning teams
 * Collaborating with other designers, the wider creative team and stakeholders
 * Being a guardian of the Cancer Research UK brand, ensuring all creative outputs adhere to Cancer Research UKâ€™s brand guidelines.
 * Following established methods of quality assurance and operational processes. Always delivering work on time to the highest standard and maintaining positive stakeholder relationships.


WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

 * Highly proficient in current design practices and relevant software within the Adobe Creative Cloud suite (primarily InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop). Flexibility to work with other software as required.
 * Strong illustration and graphic design skills to bring stories and information to life.
 * Experience and understanding of digital design, social media, email and web.
 * Relevant experience managing the full creative process, from brief to delivery
 * Relevant experience in your design discipline, with a proven track record working across print and digital in a fast-paced environment.
 * Strong communication skills, including delivering presentations and pitches to stakeholders.



Our organisation values are designed to guide all that we do.

Bold: Act with ambition, courage and determination

Credible: Act with rigour and professionalism

Human : Act to have a positive impact on people

Together: Act inclusively and collaboratively

Weâ€™re looking for people who can believe in and embody these organisation values and can use them to drive forward progress against our mission to beat cancer.

If youâ€™re interested in applying and excited about working with us but are unsure if you have the right skills and experience weâ€™d still love to hear from you.


WHAT WILL I GAIN?

We create a working environment that supports your wellbeing and provide a generous benefits package, a wide range of career and personal development opportunities and high-quality tools. Our policies and processes enable you to improve your work-life balance, take positive steps in your career and achieve your personal wellbeing goals.

You can explore our benefits by visiting our careers web page .


HOW DO I APPLY?

We operate an anonymised shortlisting process in our commitment to equality, diversity and inclusion. CVs are required for all applications; but we wonâ€™t be able to view them until we invite you for an interview. Instead, we ask you to complete the work history section of the online application form for us to be able to assess you fairly and objectively.



For more information on this career opportunity please visit our website or contact us at recruitment@cancer.org.uk .

For more updates on our work and careers, follow us on: Linked In , Facebook , Instagram , X and YouTube .



Our vision is to create a charity where everyone feels like they belong, benefits from and participates in, the work we do. We actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds and cultures, in particular those from ethnic minority backgrounds who are currently under-represented.



We want to see every candidate performing at their best throughout the job application process, interview process and whilst at work. We therefore ask you to inform us of any concerns you have or any adjustments you might need to enable this to happen. Please contact recruitment@cancer.org.uk or 0 20 3469 8400 as soon as possible.



Unfortunately, we are unable to recruit anyone below the age of 18, so that we can protect young people from health & safety and safeguarding risks.

json.job_description:
Careers


From 1969 to now, we are disruptors and pioneers at the forefront of the optical industry. Combining extraordinary design, exceptional craftmanship, and profound vision, each collection looks confidently towards the future.

With headquarters in London and Italy, and stores through the UK, US and Canada, we are proud of our dedicated, creative and collaborative team who are committed to providing industry leading eyewear and customer service. We are always looking for new members who share the same vision.

Come join us.


Job Title: Junior Graphic Designer
Department: PR & MARKETING
Reporting to: Marketing Manager / Brand and Communications Director
Location: Unit A, 58-62 White Lion St, Islington, London N1 9PP
Contract Type: Permanent, full time (4 days in office, 1 day WFH)


A brand built on friendship and rooted in craft, Cutler and Gross was established by opticians Mr Cutler and Mr Gross in 1969. They had a vision: to pioneer a new standard of eyewear. Each frame was made by hand in the workshop above the Knightsbridge store in London.
Over 55 years on and this philosophy of craftmanship remains unchanged. Taking place in Italy and Japan, the frames are handcrafted by a team of artisans who have spent decades honing their skills.
Today, the proudly independent eyewear brand has 6 flagship store locations in London, Bath, New York, Los Angeles and Toronto and has over 2000 Stockists in 50 countries around the world, and online at www.cutlerandgross.com

The Role
A junior graphic designer with creativity, attention to detail, and a passion for delivering high-quality brand assets. Youâ€™ll support the Brand and Communications team by producing engaging design work that helps bring the brand to life across both print and digital channels.
Youâ€™ll have strong typographic skills, a good eye for detail, and be eager to develop your craft across a range of design projects. A collaborative team player, youâ€™ll bring energy, professionalism, and a willingness to learn in a fast-paced luxury environment.

Key Responsibilities

 * Support the execution of brand guidelines across all touchpoints, ensuring consistency and accuracy
 * Assist in developing creative assets for seasonal campaigns, packaging, and in-store messaging
 * Design and produce marketing materials such as POS, lookbooks, invitations, and digital advertising assets
 * Develop and deliver high-quality digital assets including website content, journal, newsletters, paid social and digital advertising
 * Help with the design and upkeep of the brand website (Shopify), ensuring assets are consistent and visually aligned with brand identity
 * Collaborate with Marketing, Ecommerce, and Sales teams to support cohesive brand storytelling
 * Prepare assets for presentations and internal communications (PowerPoint decks, templates, etc.) and pull together designs for internal newsletters and updates.
 * Work with suppliers and printers to ensure high-quality output and timely delivery
 * Support in creating templates, stationery, and other corporate materials
 * Stay up to date with design trends, digital tools, and best practices to enhance your work


Skills & Experience

 * Bachelorâ€™s degree or diploma in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or a related field
 * Up to 3 years of relevant design experience (internships or freelance work also considered)
 * Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator)
 * Strong grasp of typography, colour, and layout fundamentals
 * Detail-oriented with good organisational skills and ability to manage multiple briefs
 * Strong communication skills and a collaborative, positive approach
 * Eagerness to learn and contribute ideas to creative problem solving
 * Familiarity with Figma, Shopify, or digital design tools would be a plus
 * Interest in how AI tools can support and streamline design workflows

Staff Benefits:

 * Frame and sunglass allowance
 * Generous friends and family discount
 * Annual eye test at a Cutler and Gross store
 * 25 Days holiday (+1 extra day for each additional year you work at the business (up to max of 30 days)
 * Flexible hours â€“ core hours between 10am and 4.30pm
 * WFH 6 days per month (max 2 per week) â€“ after probation
 * Regular company socials

Please send your CV and cover letter to recruitment@cutlerandgross.com.

A junior graphic designer with creativity, attention to detail, and a passion for delivering high-quality brand assets. You’ll support the Brand and Communications team by producing engaging design work that helps bring the brand to life across both print and digital channels.
You’ll have strong typographic skills, a good eye for detail, and be eager to develop your craft across a range of design projects. A collaborative team player, you’ll bring energy, professionalism, and a willingness to learn in a fast-paced luxury environment.

Key Responsibilities
  • Support the execution of brand guidelines across all touchpoints, ensuring consistency and accuracy
  • Assist in developing creative assets for seasonal campaigns, packaging, and in-store messaging
  • Design and produce marketing materials such as POS, lookbooks, invitations, and digital advertising assets
  • Develop and deliver high-quality digital assets including website content, journal, newsletters, paid social and digital advertising
  • Help with the design and upkeep of the brand website (Shopify), ensuring assets are consistent and visually aligned with brand identity
  • Collaborate with Marketing, Ecommerce, and Sales teams to support cohesive brand storytelling
  • Prepare assets for presentations and internal communications (PowerPoint decks, templates, etc.) and pull together designs for internal newsletters and updates.
  • Work with suppliers and printers to ensure high-quality output and timely delivery
  • Support in creating templates, stationery, and other corporate materials
  • Stay up to date with design trends, digital tools, and best practices to enhance your work

Skills & Experience
  • Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or a related field
  • Up to 3 years of relevant design experience (internships or freelance work also considered)
  • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator)
  • Strong grasp of typography, colour, and layout fundamentals
  • Detail-oriented with good organisational skills and ability to manage multiple briefs
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative, positive approach
  • Eagerness to learn and contribute ideas to creative problem solving
  • Familiarity with Figma, Shopify, or digital design tools would be a plus
  • Interest in how AI tools can support and streamline design workflows
Staff Benefits:
  • Frame and sunglass allowance
  • Generous friends and family discount
  • Annual eye test at a Cutler and Gross store
  • 25 Days holiday (+1 extra day for each additional year you work at the business (up to max of 30 days)
  • Flexible hours – core hours between 10am and 4.30pm
  • WFH 6 days per month (max 2 per week) – after probation
  • Regular company socials
Please send your CV and cover letter to recruitment@cutlerandgross.com.

Hourly rate: Â£28 -Â£30 an hour plus additional holiday pay
Location: London
Contract: Zero hours
Shifts: Various
Work model: Onsite

Williams Lea seeks a Graphic Designer to join our Relief Team!

Williams Lea is the leading global provider of skilled, technology-enabled, business-critical support services, with long-term trusted relationships with blue-chip clients across investment banks, law firms and professional services firms. Williams Lea employees, nearly 7000 people worldwide, who provide efficient business services at client sites in often complex and highly regulated environments, from centralised Williams Lea onshore facilities, and through best cost company offshore locations.

Purpose of role:

Our relief team offers a flexible solution to Williams Lea, often working on critical projects on client sites. As a Creative Designer within our relief team, you will be working various shifts covering holidays and sickness to ensure our services are fully staffed across multiple office locations in London, sometimes at short notice.

Your role will be varied depending on the needs of the individual client projects and every task which is undertaken must be delivered with an exceptional customer service approach.
You will demonstrate excellent client and team focus, be an all-round team player with the ability to support in various areas and show experience of providing creative and innovative proposals, with our core focus being to deliver high quality corporate information for our clients.
The Designer will work on a variety of print and digital projects. Using InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator, this role requires you to work at pace with keen attention to detail. As the Designer you will use your eye for detail and software knowledge to produce and deliver projects including business brochures, advertising, press inserts, web graphics, infographics and a variety of other print-based design work from brief through to print.
We are looking for someone with a â€˜can-doâ€™ attitude, willing to put forward ideas and have a keen eye for detail. Ensuring that all work sent out is to the highest standard and within brand guidelines. The candidate should be an extremely organised and dedicated individual with strong communications skills.

Key responsibilities:
 * Production of high-quality print and digital materials, including multimedia or complex PowerPoint
 * Work on multiple projects simultaneously, adhering to project timelines and deadlines.
 * Ensure compliance with brand guidelines, legal requirements, and industry standards.
 * Regular interaction with clients, as well as close collaboration with your creative colleagues, bringing a breadth of creativity and innovation to the team.
 * Working in a highly compliant environment, you will provide a seamless service that surpasses client briefs, whilst ensuring the delivery of on-brand creative material
 * Building strong client relationships with key stakeholders and relevant support teams, as is your ability to win client work and grow your service
 * Advising clients on print, layout, branding and deadlines.
 * Quality checking high-quality design, artwork within Client brand guidelines and to approved briefs and timescales


Key competencies:
 * Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent in graphic design
 * In depth understanding of print and design processes
 * Excellent typography and layout skills
 * Advanced knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud â€“ InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator
 * Advanced knowledge of PowerPoint
 * Experience creating and editing iPDF documents
 * Working knowledge of HTML and CSS would be an advantage
 * Working knowledge of Microsoft Office
 * Strong organisation skills and the ability to prioritise effectively
 * Ability to work to tight deadlines whilst under pressure
 * Must be able to work on their own initiative
 * Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
 * High levels of accuracy and attention to detail


Personal attributes:
 * Creative and original, able to generate unique and visually compelling designs.
 * Passione for design with a desire to stay up to date on industry trends and constantly looking for ways to improve skills.
 * Excellent attention to detail, ensuring precision in layouts, typography and colour choices.
 * Adaptability â€“ Able to adjust to different design styles, trends, and client needs.
 * Strong communication skills and ability to effectively translate ideas into visuals.
 * Able to find creative solutions to design challenges.
 * Excellent time management. Able to manage multiple projects and efficiently meet deadlines.
 * Self-motivated - able to work independently and take ownership of projects.
 * Resilient and receptive to feedback.
 * A team player.
 * Flexibility regarding working hours.


Rewards and Benefits:
We believe in supporting our employees in both their professional and personal lives. As part of our commitment to your well-being, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, including but not limited to:

 * 25 days holiday pay, plus bank holidays (dependant on hours worked)

 * Referral Scheme

 * Gym discount

 * Access to all Williams Lea internal job opportunities

 * Access to Learning Lounge and our internal training suite


You will also have the opportunity to work for a global employer who is dedicated to offering each and every employee an enjoyable, challenging and rewarding career with future career development prospects!

Equality and Diversity:
The Company values the differences that a diverse workforce brings to the organisation and will not discriminate because of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race (which includes colour, nationality and ethnic or national origins), religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation (each of these being a â€œprotected characteristicâ€ in discrimination law). It will not discriminate because of any other irrelevant factor and will build a culture that values openness, fairness and transparency.

If you have a disability and would prefer to apply in a different format or would like to make a reasonable adjustment to enable you to make an interview please contact us at
careersatWL@williamslea.com
(we do not accept applications to this email address).

https://www.williamslea.com/privacy-statement

* Job Title: In-House Graphic Designer

Location: Central London (Office-Based)

About Us:
We are a dynamic group of marketing businesses seeking a talented and creative In-House Graphic Designer to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a variety of projects, from maintaining and enhancing our in-house websites to collaborating on client projects such as website updates, flyer designs, and project-specific proposals.

Key Responsibilities:

 * Design, update, and maintain in-house websites using Elementor on WordPress.
 * Collaborate with internal teams to create visually compelling marketing materials, including flyers, brochures, and proposals.
 * Work on occasional client projects, ensuring designs align with their brand and objectives.
 * Ensure all designs are on-brand, visually appealing, and optimized for both print and digital platforms.
 * Stay up-to-date with design trends and best practices to bring fresh ideas to the table.

Requirements:

 * A degree in Graphic Design or a related field.
 * A minimum of 2 years of professional design experience.
 * Proficiency in using Elementor on WordPress.
 * Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
 * A keen eye for detail and a passion for creating high-quality designs.
 * Excellent communication and time management skills, with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
 * A proactive attitude and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.

What We Offer:

 * A competitive salary of Â£28,000 - Â£33,000 per annum.
 * A vibrant and creative work environment in central London.
 * The opportunity to work on diverse projects and make a real impact.

How to Apply:
If youâ€™re a creative thinker with a passion for design and the skills to match, weâ€™d love to hear from you! Please send your CV, portfolio, and a brief cover letter explaining why youâ€™re the perfect fit for this role.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: Â£28,000.00-Â£33,000.00 per year

Benefits:

 * Casual dress
 * Company events
 * Company pension
 * Cycle to work scheme
 * Flexitime
 * On-site parking
 * Referral programme

Education:

 * Bachelor's (required)

Experience:

 * Graphic design: 2 years (required)
 * Elementor Wordpress: 1 year (required)

Work Location: In person

about us:
itsu is the healthy eating, Asian inspired quick service retail & grocery brand with over 70 stores in the UK and a leading grocery business across Europe and beyond. Renowned for its best-in-class food made fresh in every shop every day, itsu has huge global ambitions with a commitment to continue to open many more stores and intensify the growth of its already thriving grocery arm. With its best-is-class healthy food, latest technology, innovation, and talented workforce, itsu is the future of fast food.


itsu [grocery], which this role falls under, takes the itsu brand into supermarkets, health food stores, online, wholesale and internationally with products such as crispy seaweed thins, frozen gyoza & bao, brilliantâ€™broth, riceâ€™noodles & misoâ€™easy to name a fewâ€¦


D&I statement:
itsu [grocery] is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive organisation. We encourage applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply for all of our opportunities.


When applying for a role with us, please remove your: full name, name of University/School, address, email address and any photos of you on your CV and covering letter. non-anonymised CVs may not be reviewed.


scope of the role:
 * Join the itsu grocery brand team as one of four in-house Graphic Designers
 * Support the studio team on larger projects, while taking ownership of smaller briefs
 * Ensure that all projects are delivered on time and in line with briefs, clearly communicating design project status to key stakeholders
 * Create content [still and moving images] for itsu.com & social channels [no coding knowledge or CMS experience required]
 * Work with Senior Designers, Brand Director & the marketing team on producing creative for trade and brand campaigns. Working across multiple formats inc print, digital, in-store POS, etc.
 * Supporting with photoshoot pre-production tasks
 * Create marketing collateral for internal & external presentations, brand brochures, and other internal assets.
 * Own the creation of best-in-class physical product mock-ups for internal & external meetings. Managing external printing suppliers and internal budgets & timelines.
 * Design innovation â€“curious for new, unexpected, and improved ways to express the brand



what we offer
 * Competitive salary
 * Competitive bonus scheme
 * 25 days holiday + bank holidays (two bank holidays are interchangeable for other religious holidays)
 * Health insurance
 * Company pension scheme
 * Hybrid working (1 day WFH)
 * Opportunity to work from abroad
 * 50% employee discount in itsu shops
 * Free itsu lunch
 * Discounts at major retailers
 * A sizeable training budget to support your ongoing development

json.job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION



THE AGENCY

Creative Artists Agency (CAA) is a leading entertainment and sports agency, with global expertise in filmed and live entertainment, digital media, publishing, sponsorship sales and endorsements, media finance, consumer investing, fashion, brand management and consumer product licensing, and philanthropy. Distinguished by its culture of collaboration and exceptional client service, CAAâ€™s diverse workforce identifies, innovates, and amplifies opportunities for the people and organizations that shape culture and inspire the world.




The trailblazer of the agency business, CAA was the first to build a sports business, create an investment bank, launch a venture fund, found technology start-up companies, establish a philanthropic arm, build a business in China, form brand marketing services division, and launch a family office advisory practice, among other innovations. Named Most Valuable Sports Agency by Forbes for 10 consecutive years, CAA represents more than 3,000 of the worldâ€™s top athletes in football, baseball, basketball, hockey, and soccer, in addition to coaches, on-air broadcasters, and sports personalities and works in the areas of property sales and sponsorships, media advisory, brand consulting, venue development and strategic advisory, and executive search.



Founded in 1975, CAA is headquartered in Los Angeles, and has offices in New York, London, Nashville, Munich, Shanghai, Beijing, Chicago, Washington, D.C., Singapore, Toronto, Denver, Charlotte, Jacksonville, and Atlanta, among other locations globally. For more information, please visit www.caa.com .



OVERVIEW

CAA seeks a Graphic Designer for our in-house Creative Services department. In this role, they will work directly with the Project Manager and report to the executive lead of the Creative Services Design team, both in Los Angeles. They will research, conceptualize, design, and produce outstanding creative on a wide range of projects including presentation decks, intranet materials, movie screening, party and event invitations, websites, video graphics, ads, logos, branded materials, collateral and foundation designs, Outlook email graphics and email templates for department newsletters (internal and external). The Graphic Designer is also a key part of the team who will design and produce monthly Agency staff meetings, yearly Retreats and special events. They will also work on special projects for the Agency and our clients.



Responsibilities to include but not limited to:

 * Meet with assistants, agents, executives and clients regarding photography and videography needs
 * Discuss needs with colleague, client or manager and advise on best plan to build out visual tools for internal or external needs using CAAâ€™s exclusive pitching applications to secure business opportunities for clients, colleagues, and agency as a whole
 * Work in conjunction with Head of Production and Project Manager to produce, source, organize, edit, and archive corporate and client materials
 * Handle all aspects of production for a talking-head style interview
 * Create individualized plan to showcase client materials as described in requests using creative judgement, communicate with Project Manager and stakeholders, and address notes as needed
 * Bring unique point-of-view, trained eye, natural ability for pacing, education, and specialized skillsets to every request
 * Work independently without on-site production support, managing all aspects of photo and video set-up efficiently and within tight timelines
 * Event and portrait photography
 * Color correction and photo editing
 * Navigate multiple projects in various stages of production and post-production to completion
 * Brainstorm with creative team on upcoming projects or pitches
 * Managing individual workload via assigned Asana tickets
 * Live editing during special recorded events via Livestream Studio, on-site, or other platform
 * Stay up to date on latest video and photography trends and applications to continually improve skills
 * Troubleshoot and problem-solve using vast knowledge of pre-production, production, and post-production best practices and software



QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

 * Bachelorâ€™s degree in graphic arts, fine arts, visual arts, media or a relevant experience
 * 5+ years of professional experience working in a fast-paced environment as part of a creative team
 * Stellar portfolio showcasing past work
 * Understanding of core design principals and proven exceptional taste level through collaboration with other designers in developing a corporate style guide and recreating templates for branded work
 * Excellent communication skills including the ability to articulate visioning, creative concepts, and rationale for design decisions
 * Working knowledge of collaborative design tool platforms (Figma, Miro) and templated design platforms (Campaign Monitor, Stripo, Wordpress, Canva).
 * Ability to design elevated branding for internal materials and client projects
 * Highly proficient on Mac
 * Mastery of Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign and an understanding of new technologies and ways to harness them for our work
 * Mastery of Keynote and PowerPoint
 * A positive, hard-working â€œcan-doâ€ attitude, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
 * Pride in your work and the work of the team
 * Passion for innovation
 * Eye for details, ability to carefully address notes when given
 * Demonstrated ability to work well and communicate effectively within a team and under pressure
 * Excellent communication skills
 * Desire to be a part of an organization that values teamwork and taking care of each other



Please ensure you provide complete and legible information in your application. An incomplete application may affect your consideration for employment.



Creative Artists Agency (â€œCAAâ€) is committed to promoting equal opportunities in employment and creating a workplace culture in which diversity and inclusion is valued and everyone is treated with dignity and respect. As part of our zero-tolerance approach to discrimination in any form, you and any job applicants will receive equal treatment regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation, or any other legally recognised protected basis under UK law.



Please inform CAAâ€™s Recruitment Department if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.



CAA does not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless they were contractually engaged by CAA to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any such employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the acknowledgement and agreement that CAA will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

json.title: Graphic Designer
json.descriptionHtml:
Position Summary:

The Columbus Crew are looking to add a Graphic Designer to our in-house creative group that sits within the Marketing Department. The role will report into the Creative Director, while primarily supporting the Corporate Partnerships and Business Solutions teams.

The Graphic Designer will play a key role in bringing partnership ideas to life through high quality visual content. We're seeking a talented designer who excels at working independently as they create pitch decks, branded mockups, presentations and templates in a fast-paced environment. While their focus will be with the Corporate Partnerships and Business Solutions teams, this designer will also offer design support to the Creative Services team and wider club on occasion.

This position will be required to work out of our Columbus office, attend various marketing and corporate partnerships department meetings and brainstorms- and will be asked to work some home matches, which may include weekends and holidays.

PLEASE NOTE: Applicants must include a link to their design portfolio or website to be considered for this position.

Essential DutiesResponsibilities:

  • Partner closely with the Corporate Partnerships team to develop compelling, visual collateral that supports organizational initiatives
  • Creation and development of pitch decks, presentations and templates
  • Creation of Crew and client co-branded pitch-related graphics, photos and mock-ups
  • Develop visually appealing logos, charts, infographics and iconography
  • Transform content outlines (with copy-heavy information) into visually appealing designs
  • Project manage creative requests to ensure deadlines are met and stakeholders are up to date
  • Communicate with internal and external teams to ensure brand standards are met
  • Meet deadlines while working closely with departments to deliver quality results in real-time
  • Support additional club initiatives by executing templated work and converting key visuals into additional creative across a suite of deliverables
  • Other projects and responsibilities as assigned

Required Skills, ExperienceAbilities:

  • Bachelor's degree in graphic design or a related field
  • 2-3 years of experience designing pitch decks, marketing collateral, infographics, or branded visuals
  • Proficiency in the Adobe Creative Cloud programs (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, proficiency in the rest of Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word and Excel)
  • Passion for clean presentation design with an established sense of layout hierarchy, spacing, typography, and composition
  • Ability to multi-task, meet tight deadlines and work effectively in a fast-paced, team environment
  • Highly organized, creative with strong attention to detail, both visually and grammatically
  • Strong communication and project management skills
  • Ability to exercise sound discretionary judgment
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative
  • Strong preference for candidates with experience in sports and entertainment
  • Must be able to work some evenings, weekends and holidays
json.descriptionText:
Position Summary:

The Columbus Crew are looking to add a Graphic Designer to our in-house creative group that sits within the Marketing Department. The role will report into the Creative Director, while primarily supporting the Corporate Partnerships and Business Solutions teams.

The Graphic Designer will play a key role in bringing partnership ideas to life through high quality visual content. We're seeking a talented designer who excels at working independently as they create pitch decks, branded mockups, presentations and templates in a fast-paced environment. While their focus will be with the Corporate Partnerships and Business Solutions teams, this designer will also offer design support to the Creative Services team and wider club on occasion.

This position will be required to work out of our Columbus office, attend various marketing and corporate partnerships department meetings and brainstorms- and will be asked to work some home matches, which may include weekends and holidays.

PLEASE NOTE: Applicants must include a link to their design portfolio or website to be considered for this position.

Essential DutiesResponsibilities:

Partner closely with the Corporate Partnerships team to develop compelling, visual collateral that supports organizational initiatives
Creation and development of pitch decks, presentations and templates
Creation of Crew and client co-branded pitch-related graphics, photos and mock-ups
Develop visually appealing logos, charts, infographics and iconography
Transform content outlines (with copy-heavy information) into visually appealing designs
Project manage creative requests to ensure deadlines are met and stakeholders are up to date
Communicate with internal and external teams to ensure brand standards are met
Meet deadlines while working closely with departments to deliver quality results in real-time
Support additional club initiatives by executing templated work and converting key visuals into additional creative across a suite of deliverables
Other projects and responsibilities as assigned

Required Skills, ExperienceAbilities:

Bachelor's degree in graphic design or a related field
2-3 years of experience designing pitch decks, marketing collateral, infographics, or branded visuals
Proficiency in the Adobe Creative Cloud programs (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, proficiency in the rest of Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word and Excel)
Passion for clean presentation design with an established sense of layout hierarchy, spacing, typography, and composition
Ability to multi-task, meet tight deadlines and work effectively in a fast-paced, team environment
Highly organized, creative with strong attention to detail, both visually and grammatically
Strong communication and project management skills
Ability to exercise sound discretionary judgment
Ability to work independently and take initiative
Strong preference for candidates with experience in sports and entertainment
Must be able to work some evenings, weekends and holidays

json.title: Marketing Assistant
json.descriptionHtml:
Job Posting: Marketing Assistant

JOB OPENING: Marketing Assistant
LOCATION OPTIONS: Columbus, OH
REPORTS TO: Creative Director
FLSA STATUS: Fulltime, Non-exempt, Onsite
SALARY RANGE: $50,000 – $65,000 annually

ABOUT BAY CRANE

Bay Crane is one of the nation’s leading providers of crane, rigging, and specialized transportation solutions, supporting critical infrastructure, construction, and industrial projects across the Northeast and Midwest. With decades of experience and a reputation for safety, service, and innovation, Bay Crane’s teams help move what matters—efficiently, safely, and on time.

OVERVIEW

We’re looking for a Marketing Assistant with strong graphic design and visual storytelling skills to help shape how Bay Crane looks and communicates across North America. If you’re a recent graduate or early-career designer ready to apply your creativity to real projects every day, this is your opportunity to join a fast-moving team and see your work make an impact company-wide.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Design on-brand materials for email, social media, web, print, internal communications, proposals, and events.
  • Edit short videos and digital clips for social and internal use (Premiere; After Effects a plus).
  • Retouch and organize company photo libraries and support internal photo contests.
  • Create templates, icons, and layout systems that keep our brand consistent and efficient.
  • Collaborate with branches to turn field stories and updates into engaging visuals.
  • Capture on-site photos and video (including drone footage, with training provided).
  • Prepare final files for print or digital delivery and track project deadlines.
  • Contribute new design ideas while maintaining established brand standards.

WHAT YOU’LL BRING

  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, Marketing, or a related field — or equivalent design portfolio.
  • Strong design fundamentals: typography, layout, color, and attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere); After Effects a plus.
  • Organized, self-motivated, and comfortable managing multiple projects at once.
  • Willingness to learn photography, videography, and drone capture (FAA Part 107 certification preferred but not required).
  • Experience with Lightroom, DSLR cameras, or social content formatting is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Work Location: In person
